text.text: The first MSX2+, produced by Panasonic and Sony, were released exclusively in Japan on October 21, 1988. It will bring a 256x212 pixel mode with 19,268 colors as well as horizontal hardware scrolling in addition to the vertical. A Yamaha MSX-Music cartridge offering an extension to 9 FM channels is also available. The MSX Turbo R is the last generation of MSX put on the market in 1990 to compensate for the cancellation of the MSX3. Only Panasonic has marketed its FS-A1ST and FS-A1GT in Japan. With a 16-bit RISC processor, it is the fastest of the entire MSX range.
